extraMetadata.title: Hardware Across the Web
extraMetadata.description: Hardware Across the Web is a public weekly report of the hardware used by a representative sample of the population from Firefox's release channel on desktop. This information can be used by developers to improve the Firefox experience for users.

resolution.title: Display Resolution
resolution.description: Two display resolutions, 1366x768px and 1920x1080px, stand out as the most highly-used, with the latter showing an upward trend.

gpuVendor.title: GPU Vendor
description: Intel makes up the largest part of the desktop GPU market, accounting for over 60% of our release Desktop population. AMD and Nvidia come in at 2^nd^ and 3^rd^.
Since 2016, we see that Intel has increased their share as well, going from about 60% to 66% while AMD and Nvidia both dropped from around 18% to around 14%.

hasUnity.title: Has Unity
hasUnity.description: As of March 2016, Unity dropped support for the Unity Web Player in favor of WebGL export.

cpuSpeed.title: CPU Speeds
cpuSpeed.description: A quarter of users have processors with clock speeds between 2.3 GHz and 2.69 GHz.

ram.title: Memory
ram.description: The most popular memory sizes are 4GB and 8GB, with almost one-third and one-quarter of our Release users, respectively. The number of users with 2GB of memory is trending down.

cpuCores.title: CPU Cores
cpuCores.description: Nearly 70% of users have machines with two physical cores.

cpuVendor.title: CPU Vendor
cpuVendor.description: Intel leads the share of CPUs found in our Release users, with over 88% of profiles, while AMD follows behind with about 11%.

osName.title: Operating System
osName.description: Windows 7 and Windows 10 are the most popular operating systems, accounting for almost 80% of our users. Although Windows 7 is trending down and Windows 10 is trending up, the older version still hangs on to the top spot.

browserArch.title: Browsers by Architecture
browserArch.description: In 2017, 64-bit Firefox updates fully unthrottled on Win7+ for 2GB+ users.

osArch.title: Operating Systems by Architecture
osArch.description: We see the share of 32-bit to 64-bit operating systems diverging over the last year, with 64-bit systems accounting for over 80% of our users. Note that this metric likely undercounts non-Windows OSs, as it relies on the environment.system.isWow64 Telemetry field.

hasFlash.title: Has Flash
hasFlash.description: Flash availability on Firefox shows a downward trend; Adobe will be ending support in 2020.
